thread.title: Top Democrats Question The Legitimacy Of Trump’s Victory
thread.title_full: Top Democrats Question The Legitimacy Of Trump’s Victory

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Top Democrats Question The Legitimacy Of Trump’s Victory
text:
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 13, 2017 
The former Clinton spokesman also pointed to Russia’s reported involvement in hacking Democratic National Committee and Clinton campaign emails. 
“I think Donald Trump is just trying to cling to whatever legitimacy still is in effect here,” he said. 
Fallon isn’t the only high-profile Democrat questioning the legitimacy of Trump’s victory. 
Citing the alleged Russian interference in the election, Rep. John Lewis, D-Ga., said during an interview for NBC’s Meet the Press that he will not consider Trump a legitimate president. 
When asked if he would work with Trump, Lewis responded, “It’s going to be very difficult. I don’t see this president-elect as a legitimate president.” @NBCNews @repjohnlewis needs to submit his resignation immediately Any rep that agrees must as well. This is a declaration of a coup d'etat 
— NonCompliant&Aware (@Shaggy2fields) January 13, 2017 
The comments appear to be the latest in a long series of efforts by the left to delegitimize Trump’s victory. 
Despite failed recounts and hard-fought efforts by anti-Trump forces to persuade electors to defect from Trump, the president-elect won the Electoral College with 304 votes in late December. 
Trump’s Electoral College victory was certified by Congress last Friday. 
“It is over,” Vice President Joe Biden said afterward. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
